Title: On Love
Author: অ্যাবেল দেব্রিতো
Summary:
In On Love, we see Charles Bukowski reckoning with the complications of love and desire. Alternating between the tough and the tender, the romantic and the gritty, Bukowski
exposes the myriad faces of love in the poems collected here - its selfishness and its narcissism, its randomness, its mystery and its misery, and, ultimately, its true joyfulness,
endurance and redemptive power.
Memorably moving and, at times, hilarious, On Love reveals Bukowski at his most candid and affecting.
